bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 169, Number 74 (Tuesday, May 2, 2023)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. CRANE:H.R. 3047.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article 1, Section 8, Clause 18 (Necessary and ProperClause)The single subject of this legislation is:Natural Resources[Page H2127]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.

summary.text:
Apache County and Navajo County Conveyance Act of 2023

This bill requires the Forest Service to convey certain lands within the Apache-Sitgreaves National Forest to Navajo County and Apache County, Arizona.

As a condition of each conveyance the counties must pay all associated costs, including the costs of surveys and environmental analyses.

bill.title: Apache County and Navajo County Conveyance Act of 2023

item.title: Apache County and Navajo County Conveyance Act of 2023
Apache County and Navajo County Conveyance Act of 2023
To require the Secretary of Agriculture to convey certain lands within the Apache-Sitgreaves National Forest, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
